author: A_Brickset_user
title: GREAT SET
review: This is another set I got while I was in France and it is a great construction set. It is fun to play with and fun to build. It goes well with the dumper and has a great play value. Never running out of values. Nothing wrong with it and is great to build and play with.

author: omgbrick
title: Not very eye pleasing
review:
This is probably the weakest part of the 2000 town/construction theme. There is one minifig included in this set, just your average construction worker he has a white hard hat and some blue overalls. There are no accessories except a chain it would have been nice if the worker had a shovel or something.
For ten dollars it’s fairly big because it actually uses a lot of big pieces the base is one piece with the wheels attached underneath. There is a small hinge piece that holds a hook on it. This is so you can attach either the hook of the shovel to the boom. The cockpit contains only a steering wheel. The roof can be easily removed to put the guy in it. The boom looks very weak and somewhat cartoony which I really don't like. For playability there should have been some ruble or a little thing to be moved around by the tractor even if it bumped the cost up a bit.
Overall an okay set if you like really cartoony vehicles or are looking for an okay construction set. Because of nothing to move around and an overall weird looking vehicle I have to subtract some marks. 3.5/5

author: petro17sq
title: The end of my dark edge
review:
This set is the one that put me back in the Lego business, I have had a lot of Legos  as a kid, but when I was 13 or 14 I put all my Legos in the top of my closet and had different interest in life, for almost 9 year I didn’t get any more Legos, but I always went to the toys stores and check the new set but never bought one until my girlfriend (today my wife) give me this small set as a birthday present in 2002, since that I have triple my old collection and build all my old Lego.
I am an engineer so I love all the construction set, this set as a little juniarized but is ok, the minifigure is very nice.
I am going to give this set a 5 because it was the one!

author: alva
title: Nice small set
review:
This set is among the first sets that I bought when I return from the dark age.
I found this set on 2008, on a small gift shop in my hometown, Bandung, Indonesia.
They were just stacked there, hidden between hotwheels and other toys.
It was really like found a hidden treasure. And the price is quite cheap, I bought each for Rp.69.000 (around USD 6).
Bought three sets and build one. Still keeping the other two:P
The yellow color is really nice. and the final result is really great. Especially if you have others construction line, this set really fit in nicely.

If you happens to stumble on one, my recommendation is do not think too much. Just grab it and start to build it:)

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Town (City) - 4-Wheeled Front Shovel Review
review:
This is a great set to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

There're 2 instructions in this set and both instructions don't have any mistakes.

Parts

This set has 52 pieces and it was 7 USD when it was on sale. That means that the price per piece ratio was 14 cents per piece which is a really good value for what we get here.

Minifigures

The minifig has a blue overall, an orange jacket and a white helmet. This figure also has black hair which you can see on his face.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we also don't have to worry about stickers.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/6474-1.jpg[/img]


The cockpit can sviwel full 360° and the shovel can be adjusted very easily as well. The ceiling of the cockpit can be opened and on the back of the front-end loader you can see a hook. It's a great addition to any LEGO city for sure.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de
